I personally disagree
Sounds kinda like a Herobrine knockoff.

Actually, my intention was to bring back memories of White Eyes rather than Herobrine itself. I don‚Äôt blame you, I used to think they were the same thing too. I think the Stalker would be a great way to add a sort of White Eyes without it being directly White Eyes ‚Äî it would be like fanservice for the older Minecraft community, like me. I admit I was a bit crazy when I first wrote this; I think five days without sleep for hallucinations to start is too little, and it could be bad for players who just want to mine in peace. I think it would be better if hallucinations started after seven days without sleep. I say seven because I‚Äôve never gone more than four days without sleeping in the game ‚Äî I usually go to bed before three days because of the Phantoms ‚Äî but the Stalker would still show up on the tenth day. On the seventh day without sleep, strange hallucinations would begin, and after three days of just weird things happening, the Stalker would start spawning, first just watching from afar in the darkness, and over time, attacking you. I think this would be a really cool addition as a new scary mob in Minecraft to complete the trio of terrifying mobs (Warden, Creaking, and the Stalker). What‚Äôs interesting is that ‚ÄúStalker‚Äù was already a mob Mojang once wanted to add, but instead, they ended up adding the Warden and the Creaking.

So I think during the first three days, Phantoms would spawn, just like they already do in the game. Then, three days later, the mentioned ghosts (which are literally ghosts) would start appearing. On the seventh day, along with all those mobs spawning, strange hallucinations would begin to happen. Finally, on the tenth day, the Stalker would appear. (Once the player dies, everything goes back to normal, but it can happen again if the player goes the same number of days without sleeping.) I think just those mobs spawning would already be reason enough for the player to sleep before the tenth day, and the ghosts would be even more annoying since they would spawn near you, pass through walls, and keep hitting you while levitating around you.

H√° algumas coisas que eu queria esclarecer sobre a minha ideia, mas n√£o consegui encaix√°-las devido ao limite de caracteres: as alucina√ß√µes n√£o interferem de fato na sua jogabilidade. Por exemplo, seus itens n√£o desapareceriam literalmente do seu invent√°rio ‚Äî eles apenas ficariam invis√≠veis, fazendo parecer que voc√™ os perdeu, mas, ao clicar no espa√ßo, o item ainda estaria l√°. Tamb√©m poderia haver itens falsos no seu invent√°rio. Como eu disse, s√£o "alucina√ß√µes", n√£o coisas reais. E n√£o foram feitas para serem sustos ou aterrorizantes, apenas perturbadoras.

 

Exemplos: sons de blocos quebrando, passos passando por voc√™, ouvir ru√≠dos estranhos que n√£o existem no ambiente ‚Äî como o som de um fantasma dentro de uma caverna do Mundo Superior. A neblina tamb√©m poderia ficar mais densa, quase como no Alpha. Outro detalhe estranho seria os sons de caverna acontecendo com muito mais frequ√™ncia e variedade. Esta parte √© realmente inspirada em "White Eyes" (j√° que, naquela √©poca, as pessoas pensavam que os sons estranhos de caverna eram causados ‚Äã‚Äãpor White Eyes, que √©, na verdade, como a lenda come√ßou na mesma √©poca em que esses sons foram adicionados). Mas tamb√©m foi pensado para dar a mesma vibe do mod Cave Dweller.
Ok. Ok, more ideas?
Maybe you should rename this post to something like "Tamable Endermen." I expected a full End Update thing. The usual.
OH MY GOD
this seems great. especially meerkats. they need to communicate and be loyal to their group. they should attack outsiders

Think about the possibilities in the jungle, I know frogs are coming in swamps but imagine the complexity of fish spawning from update aquatic applied to dart frogs or tree frogs in the jungles, which can drop poison when right clicked and sneaking. How about rattlesnakes in the badlands or deserts where they will only strike if you get within 2 blocks of them, it applies the poison effect and they give you an audible warning that they are present, and then their contemporary the hognose snake that looks very similar pattern wise to the rattle snake but just looks cute and you can tame, adding to the diversity of pets in minecraft, they could require sand or dirt to live in with a light source nearby. How about octopus or sting rays in oceans and birds flying overhead. Maybe when a season change update comes robins will start to spawn during autumn and winter and then disappear again in spring to be replaced by a different animal. A lot of minecraft just feels empty to me and mobs and the sounds they make will go a long way to making it feel real.

i would like to be able to get things like leather or black ink without having to kill for it.

i needed books today. felt awefull for having to kill cows :(

mushroom leather is a thing these days!

 

if people want to get leather from cows thats their choice, i just dont want to have to :)
shear a chicken get 3 feathers

In the same vein, I think it'd be cool to also have options for full on pacifism where you don't have to kill monsters either. Such as a new item for fixing elytras, or the option to make mulch instead of bonemeal (I'm assuming mulch is vegan)
Vegan leather would be essential for those who don't wanna hurt animals to make books. Chickens and parrots could drop feathers randomly.
it is a game not real life why make vegan stuff you arent actually killing real animals.
soy as a plant is a great idea, it could be used to feed animals that eat wheat and it could also be crafted into tofu or milk.. soy wax also exist i know thats too much for an item but its real

As a game that is heavily played by children and produced by a company that claims some level of ethical leadership and given the necessity of moving towards a animal product free future for the climate and just for the animals, and given Minecraft's philosophy of playing the way you want, pressuring kids to exploit animals in game when alternative exist in real life feels inconsistent with Minecraft's stated values. Having more food options with high saturation that can be obtained after meat but before golden carrots and that can be farmed reasonably automatically without villagers as well as an alternative source of leather would be ideal. Having alternatives to wool as well as milk for removing effects and making cake would be ideal. In the real world you can create just as good vegan alternative with slightly more effort and if Minecraft takes it's values and stewardship of young minds seriously it should be possible in game as well.

My daughter is 10 and (mostly) vegan. She plays Minecraft without killing cows or sheep, meaning she has to survive quite a few nights before she can make shears to then get a bed. That's achievable but hard. However, needing leather for books is pretty major, when really you don't fundamentally need leather for books. She just fishes for them I think. I think being able to craft leather from mushrooms (or maybe mushroom blocks) would be a fun alternative, and it's nice to open up multiple channels. You can already make leather from rabbit skins, so why not. Also imo it's pretty traumatic the way the cows run away from you when you hit them with a sword.
Just fired up mine raft after ten years. My 4 year old watching. He quietly asks me if we can please not hurt anymore animals. I felt terrible. Please please make this an option.

Wouldn't this make it too common though? I wouldn't be opposed to there being like a 25% chance of a scrap drop, or a 5% chance of an ingot, with these being independent and not mutually exclusive, but making it every time would seem excessive.

This would be great for preserving world size/terrain as well as for game modes like skyblock. Realistically every item in the game should be renewable by some means, even if it was a rare way. Such as this or allowing the ender dragon to give an egg every time it is killed and not just the original
